original_definition: 'Vertical multistage water pump' means a glanded multi stage (i > 1) rotodynamic water pump in which the impellers are assembled on a vertical rotating shaft, which is designed for pressures up to 25 bar, with a nominal speed of 2 900 rpm and a maximum flow of 100 m3/h (27,78·10–3 m3/s);
generated_definition: 'Vertical multistage water pump' means a water pump with multiple stages of impellers, designed to lift water from one level to another within a vertical shaft, typically for industrial or domestic use.

Article 2: ‘Vertical multistage water pump’ (MS-V) means a glanded multi stage (i > 1) rotodynamic water pump in which the impellers are assembled on a vertical rotating shaft, which is designed for pressures up to 25 bar, with a nominal speed of 2 900 rpm and a maximum flow of 100 m3/h (27,78·10–3 m3/s);

‘Vertical multistage water pump’ (MS-V) means a glanded multi stage (i > 1)rotodynamic water pump in which the impellers are assembled on a vertical rotating shaft, which is designed for pressures up to 25 bar, with a nominal speed of 2 900 rpm and a maximum flow of 100 m3/h (27,78·10–3 m3/s);
Article 8: All efficiencies are based on full (untrimmed) impeller.Vertical multistage water pumps are to be tested with a 3 stage (i = 3) version.Submersible multistage water pumps are to be tested with a 9 stage (i = 9) version. If this number of stages is not offered within the specific product range the next higher number of stages within the product range is to be chosen for testing.

All efficiencies are based on full (untrimmed) impeller. Vertical multistage water pumps are to be tested with a 3 stage (i = 3) version. Submersible multistage water pumps are to be tested with a 9 stage (i = 9) version. If this number of stages is not offered within the specific product range the next higher number of stages within the product range is to be chosen for testing.
